title: The Palindromic Time Converter
description:
# The Palindromic Time Converter

Given a 24-hour formatted time, find the next time that is a palindrome when read forwards and backwards. The time is given as input in the format HH:MM. If the input time is already palindromic, return the same time. The palindrome is checked using the time format itself (ignoring the colon). Every time is valid between 00:00 and 23:59. Your task is to output the next palindromic time. The time should wrap around if necessary (i.e., after 23:59, it should go back to 00:00).

## Example 1

Input:

~~~txt
11:11
~~~

Output:

~~~txt
11:11
~~~

## Example 2

Input:

~~~txt
02:30
~~~

Output:

~~~txt
03:30
~~~
